title: Can you use your phone as a USB drive? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes anyone can use it as a USB drive and infact if we need to save any of our in micro sd card then that would be possible through your mobile and all you need is a data cable which your mobile supports (micro usb 2.0 or usb type c cable) connect it to your PC or any other device from which you need to transfer your data and now a days android phones come with a setup which is we need to change the settings manually when the device is connected to PC . Simple way is just drag down your notification bar and there a new notification would be visible click on it and change it to FTP or FILE TRANSFER PORT and then you can proceed to your storage. I hope my answer helps you some extent

Yes, If you are android phone.Just switch on devlepor option , <on USB debugging, <select USB configuration as -MTP(Media Transfer protocol) Now your device can be as USB drive. Make use of this for transfer data in laptop ,led TV ,chromecst in some devices,,,,etc To switch on debugging option go to <about phone <click 7times on build Number it will turn your phone ‘s setting into developer option.

Yes you can but keep in mind if any malware or virus enters your phone then it might affect your phone and your phone can malfunction…. And the data transfer rate of phone is less as compared to a usb flash drive….
